name: Ellerthwaite Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a lovely hotel, and the staff and owners were really great! They were very polite and were always willing to give suggestions on things to see and do in the area.
reviews.title: Beautiful!
Fantastic stay!
reviews.text: The room was spotless and modern, and the bed was very comfortable, and the view from the bay window was lovely.
Breakfast was brilliant too! There was a spread of cereal, fuit and juices, and as well as that you could have a full english breakfast!
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back again and again!

likes.liked: — The whole stay was fantastic but the qualiry of the rooms and the staff were superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I fully recommend this lodge, as it is only a 5 minute walk from the shops, restaurants, and pubs.
reviews.title: Good B & B accomodation centrally located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to stop in the Lake District on the way down to stay with friends in Bristol. In booking this place we couldn't have asked for more. From the very warm welcome we received, the lovely newly refurbished room to the excellent breakfast. Well situated in Windermere, so easy to get around on foot as well as by car. All that was missing was evening meals but with the whole of Windermere at your disposal that isn't a problem and the small coffee shop on site makes up for this.
reviews.title: Home from Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In fact we liked this place so much we booked a room for the return journey!
reviews.title: Cheated and deceived!

likes.disliked: — The room and the twin beds passed off as a double

reviews.text: I booked this lodge through booking.com as a last minute get away birthday surprise for my boyfriend and I. When we arrived the gentleman who greeted us, presumebly the owner, was very polite and friendly. However when I came to sign for the room, I noticed that it stated "twin room" instead of double which the owner was quick to correct me on and reassured me it was a double room.
reviews.title: Very disappointed

likes.disliked: — bedroom and en-suite desperately needed refurbishment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was small and cosy but when the radiator was on we could smell a burning smell due to the radiator being recently painted. The bed was ok to sleep in but it was only on the last night when I found myself sinking in a gap, that the bed was not a double bed but two twins pushed together. The morning we were leaving I notified the female member of staff who was checking us out of our room that I was not informed on arrival that the bed was two singles, only reassured that it was not a twin room. She merely apologised and claimed that we would have been moved to "a double-double" had she known and happily took the rest of the payment!
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise

reviews.text: The breakfast was lovely and the service satisfactory which makes it a shame that we both felt cheated and deceived into believing we were sleeping on a proper double bed. It was a lovely stay but really was not worth the money I paid and probably would not stay again.
reviews.title: Lived up to (hopeful) expectations

likes.liked: — It was friendly, peaceful, immaculately clean.

description: A short walk from Lake Windermere, this charming 19th-century Lake District town house provides 15 relaxing, comfortably furnished en-suite rooms for you to enjoy bed and breakfast accommodation in Windermere. Our rooms have been dressed with bespoke soft furnishings, excelsior deluxe mattresses, 20” flat screen Samsung TVs with 10 channels and in the lounge area you can relax on leather chesterfields and take in the far reaching views. Parking is also not a problem as we have private car park with ample space for all. You are only 2 minutes walk from Windermere town centre with its variety of shops and selection of good quality restaurants which is why we have chosen to only cater for bed and breakfast. Ellerthwaite Lodge is ideally situated and provides a great place to stay to enjoy the Lake District.
